text:
Title: Interstellar (2014)
Director: Christopher Nolan
Stars: Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway, Jessica Chastain, Michael Caine, Casey Affleck, Wes Bentley, Mackenzie Foy, Timothée Chalamet, Bill Irwin, David Gyasi, Ellen Burstyn, John Lithgow, Topher Grace, David Oyelowo, William Devane, Josh Stewart, Cornelius Smith Jr., Jesse Luken, David Dastmalchian, Sean Patrick Thomas, Mackenna Grace, Timothée Chalamet, Sarah Wayne Callies, Haley Joel Osment, Matt Damon, Cillian Murphy
Genres: Adventure, Drama, Sci-Fi
Language: English
Runtime: 169 min
Release Date: 7 November 2014 (USA)
Country: USA
Plot Keywords: space travel, time travel, wormhole, astronaut, exploration

Interstellar is a science fiction epic that follows Cooper (Matthew McConaughey), a former NASA pilot who must leave his children behind to save humanity from extinction when Earth becomes uninhabitable due to food shortages and extreme weather conditions. With the help of a brilliant scientist named Brand (Anne Hathaway), he embarks on an interstellar journey through a wormhole near Saturn in search of a new home for mankind. Along the way, they encounter various challenges and discoveries, including black holes, exoplanets, and advanced intelligent beings. The film explores themes such as love, sacrifice, hope, and the human spirit's ability to adapt and overcome adversity.

Cast and crew:

* Director: Christopher Nolan
* Producers: Emma Thomas, Christopher Nolan, Lynzee Klingman, Jordan Goldberg, Hans Zimmer
* Screenplay by: Jonathan Nolan, Christopher Nolan, based on a story by Jonathan Nolan, Christopher Nolan, and Kip Thorne
* Cinematography: Hoyte van Hoytema
* Editing: Lee Smith
* Production design: Nathan Crowley
* Music by: Hans Zimmer, Jonny Greenwood
* Casting by: Douglas Aibel, Francine Maisler

Supporting cast:

* John Lithgow as Donald Brand
* Mackenzie Foy as Murph Cooper
* Timothée Chalamet as Tom Cooper
* Bill Irwin as Amelia Brand
* David Gyasi as Romilly
* Ellen Burstyn as Professor Brand
* Michael Caine as Profesor John Doyle
* Casey Affleck as Tom Cooper (adult)
* Wes Bentley as Doyle's assistant
* Topher Grace as General Edward Mann
* Cornelius Smith Jr. as Colonel Joseph Cooper
* Jesse Luken as Lieutenant Tarpinian
* David Dastmalchian as Romilly's partner
* Sean Patrick Thomas as Colonel Weathers
* Mackenna Grace as Young Murph
* Sarah Wayne Callies as Mrs. O'Donnell
* Haley Joel Osment as S.T.A.R.S. voice
* Matt Damon as Dr. Robert Forster
* Cillian Murphy as Dr. John Bedford Ford

Technical aspects:

* IMDb rating: 8.6/10
* Budget: $165–$190 million
* Box office: $677.5 million
* Aspect ratio: 2.39:1
* Audio format: Dolby Atmos, DTS HD Master Audio 5.1

Quotes:

* "We used to look up at the night sky and wonder where we came from. Now we know. The universe is a pretty big place. If you don't mind, I'm kind of thinking about other things right now." – Cooper
* "The greatest danger facing us today is complacency. Complacency born of success. Complacency bred into the bones of our civilization over centuries. And that complacency may be our undoing." – Professor Brand
* "If you could save humankind by destroying Earth, would you do it?" – Amelia Brand
* "Love is not something you go to. Love is something that finds you or knocks you down. And maybe picks you up." – Murph Cooper

Trivia:

* The movie was inspired by real scientific concepts like gravitational singularities, wormholes, and the possibility of finding habitable planets outside our solar system.
* Filming locations included Alberta, Canada, and California,
